merge module

This module provides merge_csv() function to merge CSV files into a single pandas DataFrame.

copyright:

© 2025 by Jaywan Chung

license:

MIT

merge.df_to_csv(df, csv_filename, logger)

Save the pandas DataFrame as a CSV file.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – A pandas DataFrame to be saved.

  • csv_filename (str) – The name of CSV file.

  • logger (logger.Logger) – A logger for storing messages.

merge.df_to_excel(df, excel_filename, logger)

Save the pandas DataFrame as an Excel file.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – A pandas DataFrame to be saved.

  • excel_filename (str) – The name of Excel file.

  • logger (logger.Logger) – A logger for storing messages.

merge.merge_csv(rootdir, header_in_csv_filename: str, tail_in_csv_filename: str, logger: Logger, delete_errorfile: bool = False) → DataFrame

Merge all CSV files under the rootdir directory into a single pandas DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • rootdir (str) – Root directory containing CSV files to be merged.

  • header_in_csv_filename (str) – Only CSV files starting with header_in_csv_filename is merged.

  • tail_in_csv_filename (str) – Only CSV files ending with tail_in_csv_filename is merged.

  • logger (logger.Logger) – A logger for storing messages.

  • delete_errorfile (bool) – If True, CSV file with header incompatible with other CSV files is deleted. Default is False.

Returns:

A merged table.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame
